topRanked.articleTitle: Taxonomy and distribution of the flea beetle Altica ivlievi L. Medvedev, 1968 (Coleoptera: Chrysomelidae: Galerucinae: Alticini)
topRanked.summary: Altica ivlievi is a species of beetle in the family Cerambycidae. It is a relatively small beetle with distinct frontal tubercles and triangularly-rounded carinae. The female has a distinctive vaginal palpi arrangement, while the male has a sharp frontal carina and narrow, sharp elytra with larger punctures and microsculpture.

images.captionText: Figs 6–10. Altica ivlievi, female: 6 – imago, general view; 7 – left mandible; 8 – spermatheca; 9 – styles; 10 – tignum. (Sikhote-Alin Reserve, 18.IV 2018).
Fig. 11. Feeding and copulating beetles of Altica ivlievi on the leaves of Betula platyphylla Sukacz. (Sikhote-Alin Reserve, 11.V 2018).

response.answer: Zicrona caerulea is a species of beetle that is found in Russia and the Amur Region. It is closely related to Altica ivlievi but differs by its sharp frontal carina and shape of frontal tubercles.
